question.title: geckolib HumanoidArmorLayerMixin Critical injection failure No refMap loaded NeoForge
question.body:
I been decided to move over from forge over to NeoForge and I am working on a mod for version 1.21.1 of Minecraft using Neoforge version 21.1.176 and Geckolib version 4.6.5

I got the project to compile finaly but on loading I get this error Critical injection failure: Callback method geckolib$renderGeckoLibModel(...) in geckolib.mixins.json:client.HumanoidArmorLayerMixin from mod geckolib failed injection check, (0/1) succeeded. Scanned 0 target(s). No refMap loaded.

Now I have been looking about and most of the search results came up empty for me what am I doing wrong, as I fallowed the setup instructions for NeoForge and Geckolib so this crash on the client should not happen.

answers.body:
You're encountering a critical mixin injection failure when using NeoForge 21.1.176 with GeckoLib 4.6.5 on Minecraft 1.21.1.

This kind of error usually stems from either misconfiguration or version incompatibility, especially since Mixin relies heavily on properly loaded refMaps and accurate targets.

  1. Add and correctly configure refMap in build.gradle

  2. Confirm HumanoidArmorLayer exists in 1.21.1

  3. Verify compatibility of GeckoLib 4.6.5 with NeoForge 21.1.176

  4. Clean and rebuild project (./gradlew clean build)

  5. Try running with a debugger or more verbose logs (--debug) if needed

Let me know if you need help
